subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Paganism Reborn: The Rise of Wicca and Neo-Paganism
description: A quick win: understand Paganism Reborn: The Rise of Wicca and Neo-Paganism.

hook.text: Witchcraft is one of the fastest-growing religions in America. Wicca went from fringe to mainstream in one generation.

buildup.text: Gerald Gardner launched Wicca in the 1950s, claiming ancient roots. Modern Paganism reveres nature and the feminine.

discovery.text: Wicca has no central authority, no scripture, no dogma. Practitioners create their own rituals. Freedom is the appeal.

twist.text: Most Wiccans are young women drawn by feminism and environmentalism. Traditional religion failed them; nature didn't.

climax.text: Neo-Paganism shows that dead religions can be reinvented. People will create new faiths when old ones stop serving them.

punchline.text: Wicca revived old gods for modern seekers. Dead religions can come back.

quiz.question: Why is Wicca growing?
options: It offers nature-based spirituality without the dogma of traditional religions
